title: Most people prefer Facebook and Twitter's early actions over not responding: The NYTimes' Roose
text: Kevin Roose, New York Times, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss whether the current social media regulation is outdated and the criticism surrounding Big Tech.

title: Instagram faces EU probe over potential exposure of children's contact details
text: Ireland's Data Protection Commission has opened two inquiries into Instagram for how it handles children's data.

title: WSJ's Deepa Seetharaman on Zuckerberg's transition to active political operator
text: Deepa Seetharaman, Wall Street Journal, joins 'Squawk Alley' to discuss her piece on Mark Zuckerberg's transformation, his relationships with policymakers and civil rights activists and if Facebook is ready this presidential election cycle.

title: EU Regulator Investigates Instagram's Handling Of Children's Personal Data
text: The investigation comes amid reports that Instagram allegedly failed to protect data, including email addresses and phone numbers of minors.

title: Justice Department's antitrust chief Makan Delrahim on Big Tech regulation
text: Makan Delrahim, Assistant Attorney General for the Anti-Trust Division, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss Big Tech regulation and antitrust policy amid the controversy behind Facebook and Twitter's decision to limit a New York Post article about the son of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. He also discusses the future of 5G.

title: Facebook's (FB) Instagram Faces Probe for Data Privacy Issues
text: Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC) starts an investigation on Facebook's (FB) Instagram over handling of children's personal data.

title: Republican Senator Calls For Facebook To Be Broken Up
text: Last week, we noted Republicans' anger at Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR) and Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) for their suppression of the New York Post's article about Hunter Biden (Twitter Incurs Republicans' Wrath). That anger increased on Saturday with Senator Josh Hawley of Missouri calling for Facebook to be broken up.

title: Japan joining forces with US and Europe to regulate Big Tech
text: Japan is joining the fight against Big Tech's market dominance. The head of the country's antitrust watchdog said Monday that it would be teaming up with the US and Europe to tackle efforts to regulate the four biggest names in Silicon Valley, adding that Tokyo could open a probe into Google's attempted Fitbit merger.

title: Instagram's handling of kids' data is now being probed in the EU
text: Facebook's lead data regulator in Europe has opened another two probes into its business empire — both focused on how the Instagram platform processes children's information. The action by Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC), reported earlier by the Telegraph, comes more than a year after a US data scientist reported concerns to Instagram that its […]

title: Instagram investigated over children's data leak
text: Instagram is being investigated for a potential leak of children's personal information by the Irish privacy watchdog, which is the EU's lead authority on Facebook.
